clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of IgY Antibody Effectiveness in Supportive Therapy of Periodontitis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Patients visiting National Hospital of Odonto-Stomatology for treating periodontitis used a food supplement (lozenge) containing chicken egg antibody (IgY) against Porphyromonas gingivalis gingipains as an adjunct to conventional scaling and root planing (SRP). After 8 weeks the patients were examined against. Parameters including probing depth (PD), bleeding on probing (BOP), number of P. gingivalis in periodontal pockets were evaluated and compared to the control group that had used placebo lozenges.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-gingipain IgY on probing pocket depth of subjects with chronic periodontitis
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measurement is probing pocket depth (PD)

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-gingipain IgY on bleeding on probing of subjects with chronic periodontitis
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measurement is bleeding on probing (BOP)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of anti-gingipain IgY on Porphyromonas gingivalis level of subjects with chronic periodontitis
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measurement is P. gingivalis level in periodontal pockets

arm_group.description: Participants consume lozenges containing IgY against gingipains of Porphyromonas gingivalis
Participants consume lozenges containing placebo IgY

intervention.description: Patients consumed food supplement lozenges containing IgY after nonsurgical periodontal therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients diagnosed with chronic periodontitis
- had at least 2 interproximal site with pocket depth between 3 mm to 5 mm
- nonsmokers with at least 20 natural teeth
- bone loss and bleeding on probing
- had not undergone periodontal treatments within 6 weeks before the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients received medication such as antibiotics or anti-inflammatory drugs within the previous 3 months
- had allergy to egg proteins
